oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Relationship Between Antibiotic Susceptibility of Mastitis Pathogens and Treatment Outcomes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hoe, Fernanda G. H.
Ruegg, Pamela L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: mastitis therapy
efficacy
susceptibility tests
inhibitory concentration
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The efficacy of mastitis therapy depends on inherent characteristics of the pathogen, the duration of therapy, host factors and the concentration of antibiotic that can be maintained at the site of infection. Susceptibility tests of mastitis pathogens are often used to guide treatment decisions, but the clinical relevancy of susceptibility testing has been challenged. The objective of this study was to determine the relationship between minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of mastitis pathogens and outcomes of clinical mastitis.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2005; 173
